1.text: Now the Spirit has clearly said that, in the end times, some persons will depart from the faith, paying attention to spirits of error and the doctrines of devils,

2.text: speaking lies in hypocrisy, and having their consciences seared,

3.text: prohibiting marriage, abstaining from foods, which God has created to be accepted with thanksgiving by the faithful and by those who have understood the truth.

4.text: For every creature of God is good, and nothing is to be rejected which is received with thanksgiving;

5.text: for it has been sanctified by the Word of God and by prayer.

6.text: By proposing these things to the brothers, you will be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished by words of faith, and by the good doctrine that you have secured.

7.text: But avoid the silly fables of old women. And exercise yourself so as to advance in piety.

8.text: For the exercise of the body is somewhat useful. But piety is useful in all things, holding the promise of life, in the present and in the future.

9.text: This is a faithful saying and worthy of full acceptance.

10.text: For this reason we labor and are maligned: because we hope in the living God, who is the Savior of all men, most especially of the faithful.

12.text: Let no one despise your youth, but be an example among the faithful in word, in behavior, in charity, in faith, in chastity.

13.text: Until I arrive, attend to reading, to exhortation, and to doctrine.

14.text: Do not be willing to neglect the grace that is within you, which was given to you through prophecy, with the imposition of the hands of the priesthood.

15.text: Meditate on these things, so that your progress may be manifest to all.

16.text: Pay attention to yourself and to doctrine. Pursue these things. For in doing so, you will save both yourself and those who listen to you.
